citation.article-title: Syntrophococcus sucromutans gen. nov., sp. nov. uses carbohydrates as electron donors and formate, methoxymonobenzenoids or Methanobrevibacter as electron acceptor systems

p.s: Syntrophococcus (Syn.tro.pho.coc'cus. Gr. adj., syn together with; Gr. n., trophos one who feeds; Gr. n., coccus a grain, berry; M. L. Masc. n. Syntrophococcus coccus which feeds together with (another species))
Sugars are used as electron donors with acetate as the only organic product and H2-CO2-using methanogens serve as an electron acceptor system.
Habitat: Mesophilic, anaerobic, microbial ecosystems where complex organic matter is degraded.
